result.execSummary:
The defendant Quadarius Rashaad Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying Concealed Weapon. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quadarius Rashaad Richardson

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.

Petitioner Quadarius Rashaad Richardson in court.  Attorney Christopher L Morgan in court for Margaret Daun.  Case in court for return of glock firearm. Milwaukee County has no objection for the return of firearm.  Petitioner sworn.  Statements from  petitioner.  Order, signed and filed
Return of property hearing on September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Return of property hearing on September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case was erroneously scheduled in error in another branch. Petitioner appeared in Br. 15. Case is calendared for a Petition for Return of Property scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 1:30pm in Room 623CH.
Received and Filed by Attorney Christopher Morgan.

Defendant Quadarius Rashaad Richardson not in court. 

Matter in court for Return of Property.

Petition DENIED, due to non-appearance of the defedant.
Return of property hearing on August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Milwaukee Sheriff Department Inventory # 22000084
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $510.00 entered as ordered by the court on 07/12/22 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 06/01/23. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:  CHRISTIN MARIE SAINT PIERRE  $510.00
of Attorney Fees and Costs, Signed, Filed and Forwarded to Clerk of Court for processing,

Per email correspondence with defense counsel.   
Charge amended to Carry Concealed Weapon Citation pursuant to s. 63.015 Wis. Stats. and not 343.18(1),
of Representation by Attorney Saint Pierre

Pursuant to the Stipulation of the Parties, Court Ordered:     
Charge amended to Violation of Carrying a  Concealed Weapon  pursuant to 343.18(1) Wis. Stats. to which Defendant plead no contest. 
Court finds defendant guilty of amended charge.  Court orders a forfeiture in the amount of $350..00 including costs to be paid in 6  MONTHS  Or civil judgment.
and Stipulation Amending charge, received and forward to Judge.

Defendant Quadarius Rashaad Richardson in court with attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Status Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and potential dpa offer. State confirms pending tad evaluation results.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom. Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Per call from Attorney Saint Pierre requesting to appear on May 13, 2022 in place of 5-12-2022. Request granted by the court. Counsel to notify client of new day and time.
Status of Counsel scheduled May 13, 2022 at 9:00am - via Zoom.
Attorney Christin Saint Pierre.
Signed and Filed.

Defendant Quadarius Rashaad Richardson in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status of counsel.  Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  
Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Christin Saint Pierre to represent defendant at County expense  at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 Per Month. Repayment to begin 30 Days after the conclusion of the case.  Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment.
Court ordered matter adjourned for Status of Counsel. 
This hearing will be held in person.  
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Quadarius Rashaad Richardson in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. 
Case in court for Pretrial Conference. Defendant appears Pro se and is not eligible for public defender appointment. Defendant advised of right to counsel.  
Court examined defendant as to his request to represent himself and waiver of counsel.
Further discussion held with defendant. Court instructed defendant to make a good faith effort to hire private counsel and will revisit his request to represent himself.
Court ordered matter adjourned for status of counsel. Case remains calendared in Branch 19.    

This hearing will be held in person.
  Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Quadarius Rashaad Richardson in court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge  Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/9/22 @ 1p
